data.title: Canford School
data.text:
There are many different sport options for pupils to choose from across their time at Canford. Listed below are Canfordâ€™s focus team sports, our core sports and some of other sports that are available for pupils to take part in. Sport options may differ depending on the year group.

Focus team sports are currently Rugby, Hockey, Cricket and Netball

Core sports are currently Rowing, Tennis, Real tennis & Squash, Football, Athletics

Other sports include Golf, Lacrosse and Swimming

Athletics takes place during the Summer Term.

Read More about Athletics

There can be few more delightful settings for cricket than the grounds at Canford.

Read More about Cricket

Football has increased in popularity sees the school putting out two, sometimes three senior teams.

Read More about Football

Within the grounds of Canford School there is an excellent 9-hole golf course.

Read More about Golf

Canford has a strong reputation of excellence and success in hockey.

Read More about Hockey

Lacrosse is played by girls during the Christmas and Easter Terms from the Fifth Form upwards.

Read More about Lacrosse

Netball is played as a focus sport in the Easter Term.

Read More about Netball

Canford gives pupils a unique opportunity to play one of only 44 Real tennis courts in the world.

Read More about Real tennis and Squash

Rowing is a key sport at Canford for the Easter and Summer Terms.

Read More about Rowing

Rugby is played at Canford as a focus team sport in the Christmas Term.

Read More about Rugby

The running team welcomes all abilities and supports and develops elite runners to complete beginners.

Read More about Running

Swimming takes place in all three terms with the summer being the main competitive one.

Read More about Swimming

We encourage pupils to develop their tennis to their highest level.

Read More about Tennis
